body_html: @byronyi 6448f41 allows a BFC allocator to be used instead of a pool allocator for the CPUAllocator, because pool allocators can run out of memory quickly if many allocs and frees are made with many different sizes. I know almost nothing about NUMA and RDMA, but since 6448f41 did not change the host allocator, I don't think it will have an affect on RDMA.
